isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - SINGLE REDUCTION, SINGLE SPEED AXLES: SPICER D135-S, F155-S, F170-S SERIES - INSTALL

step1.para: Assemble oil pickup cup onto differential case ( Figure 60). Tighten to 7 to 9 ft-lbs. (9 to 12 N•m).
Install ring gear and differential assembly into carrier housing ( Figure 61). Tilt differential slightly so ring gear clears straddle bearing support.

figure.caption: Figure 61. Ring Gear and Differential Assembly Into Carrier Housing

caution.para: Care should be used when installing ring gear and differential into carrier housing so damage to ring gear, pinion, bearings, or bearing bores does not occur.

step1.para: Be sure bearing cups are seated on bearing cones. Assemble differential bearing caps. Clean bearing cap bolts and coat threads with Loctite #277 or equivalent. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION AND SEALERS in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual. Install bearing cap bolts (finger tight only). Install adjusting rings.
Tighten adjusting ring on the back side of the ring gear until there is zero (0) backlash between ring gear and pinion.

Tighten adjusting ring on tooth side of ring gear until bearing cup is seated. Continue to tighten adjusting ring until gear backlash is set to specification etched on the edge of the ring gear ( Figure 62).

figure.caption: Figure 62. Adjusting Ring On Tooth Side

step1.para: Check ring gear and pinion backlash in four equally spaced positions around the ring gear with dial indicator ( Figure 63).

figure.caption: Figure 63. Check Ring Gear & Pinion Backlash

note.para: If the backlash tolerance does not vary more than .002 in. (.050 mm), the setting is acceptable.

step1.para: Once backlash is set, tighten the differential bearing cap bolts to 115 to 135 ft-lbs. (156 to 183 N•m) ( Figure 64).

figure.caption: Figure 64. Tighten Differential Bearing Cap Bolts
